Mo_Pitney:
{{Short description|American country music singer (born 1992)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=July 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Mo Pitney | image = | caption = | image_size = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|03|24}} | birth_name = Morgan Daniel Pitney | birth_place = [[Cherry Valley, Illinois]] | origin = | instrument = | genre = [[Neotraditional Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 2014–present | label = [[Curb Records|Curb]] | associated_acts = | website = {{URL|www.mopitney.com}} }} '''Morgan Daniel Pitney'''{{cite web|url=http://repertoire.bmi.com/writer.asp?blnWriter=True&blnPublisher=True&blnArtist=True&page=1&fromrow=1&torow=25&querytype=WriterID&keyid=1336961&keyname=PITNEY+MORGAN+DANIEL&CAE=642109082&Affiliation=BMI|title=Songwriter/Composer: PITNEY MORGAN DANIEL|last=Pitney|first=Morgan Daniel|publisher=[[Broadcast Music, Inc.]] (BMI)|accessdate=July 4, 2015}} {{Dead link|date=August 2019 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} (born March 24, 1993, in [[Cherry Valley, Illinois]]{{cite web|last=Deming|first=Mark|title=Mo Pitney {{!}} Biography|url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=mn0003373877/biography|pure_url=yes}}|work=[[AllMusic]]|accessdate=June 3, 2015}}) is an American [[country music]] singer. In May 2014, he signed to [[Curb Records]].{{cite news|last1=Stephenson|first1=Troy|title=Curb Records Adds Mo Pitney to Roster|url=http://www.musicrow.com/2014/05/curb-records-adds-mo-pitney-to-roster/|accessdate=June 3, 2015|work=[[MusicRow]]|date=May 7, 2014}} He has released two studio albums: ''Behind This Guitar'' (2016), and ''Ain't Lookin' Back'' (2020) ==Musical career== Mo Pitney was born in [[Rockford, Illinois]]. He began playing drums at 6 and guitar at 12. He played in a bluegrass band with his brother and a friend. Pitney moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee]], where he signed to [[Curb Records]] and began working with record producer [[Tony Brown (record producer)|Tony Brown]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.curb.com/artists/mo-pitney|title = Mo Pitney and Ruthie Collins have been named judges of American Songwriter Magazine's 2020 Lyric Contest}} Pitney released his single "Country", in December 2014. He co-wrote the song with [[Bill Anderson (singer)|Bill Anderson]] and Bobby Tomberlin. Billy Dukes of [[Taste of Country]] reviewed the single positively, saying that "Mo isn’t making a statement, and he’s not the sign of some traditional country revolution in 2015. But he’s a reminder of how good a simple country song sung by a man who believes in God and [[George Strait]] can feel."{{cite news|last1=Dukes|first1=Billy|title=Mo Pitney, 'Country' – ToC Critic's Pick [Listen]|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/mo-pitney-country/|accessdate=June 3, 2015|work=Taste of Country|date=December 16, 2014}} Johnny Nevin of [[Huffington Post]] also reviewed Pitney's music favorably, saying that "Mo Pitney knows a couple of really important things about being Country, real Country. One of them is that he knows who he is, and that's always going to be important, because it's the only way anyone can keep becoming the person they really want to be. Just as important though, it seems like Mo Pitney never forgets about everybody else, and how important they are too."{{cite news| url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/johnny-nevin/real-music-real-country-a_b_6497350.html | work=Huffington Post | title=Real Music, Real Country, And What's Important to Mo Pitney | date=January 18, 2015}} It was the third most added country song its first week at radio.{{cite news|last1=Bjorke|first1=Matt|title=Mo Pitney – "Country"|url=http://roughstock.com/tracks/2015/06/32745-mo-pitney-country/|accessdate=June 3, 2015|work=Roughstock|date=June 1, 2015}} The song entered Top 40 on [[Country Airplay]] on the chart dated for the week ending June 20, 2015, its nineteenth week on that chart.[http://www.billboard.com/files/pdfs/0608_country_update.pdf Billboard Country Update] ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''. June 8, 2015, p. 10 {{webarchive|date=June 15, 2015|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150615155718/http://www.billboard.com/files/pdfs/0608_country_update.pdf}} His second single, "[[Boy & a Girl Thing (song)|Boy & a Girl Thing]]", released to country radio on August 31, 2015. It reached #50 on [[Hot Country Songs]] in October 2016. His debut album is ''Behind This Guitar''. The album's third single, "Everywhere", went for adds at country radio on February 13, 2017.{{cite web| url = https://www.musicrow.com/calendars-2/single-releases/| title = New Releases - MusicRow - New Albums, Singles & Industry Events| date = January 4, 2013}} Pitney's debut album, ''Behind This Guitar'', was released on October 7, 2016, and featured collaborations with [[Morgane Stapleton]] and [[Mac McAnally]].{{cite magazine |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/country/news/mo-pitney-details-debut-album-behind-this-guitar-w431689 |title=Mo Pitney Details Debut Album 'Behind This Guitar' |first= Stephen L. |last=Betts |magazine=Rolling Stone |date=July 29, 2016 }}{{cite web| url = https://www.axs.com/mo-pitney-readies-debut-album-behind-this-guitar-103686| url-status = dead| archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20180217024002/https://www.axs.com/mo-pitney-readies-debut-album-behind-this-guitar-103686| archive-date = 2018-02-17| title = Mo Pitney readies debut album 'Behind This Guitar' - AXS}} It charted at No. 10 on ''Billboard'''s [[Top Country Albums]] in its first week.{{cite magazine |url=http://www.billboard.com/charts/country-albums/2016-10-29 |title=Top Country Albums |date=October 29, 2016 |magazine=Billboard }} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:16em;"| Detai ! rowspan="2" style="width:9em;"| Sales |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="45"| [[Top Country Albums|US Country]]
